content:
The effective date of the above cover shall commence after this Policy has been purchased or within thirty (30) days before the date of commencement of the scheduled Trip.

Once You cancel the Trip and a claim is made under Section 19, the Policy will terminate immediately.

**N.B.** This Policy will only pay for a claim made under either Sections 19 or 22 or 29 for the same event but not for more than one of the Sections.
questions: What are the implications of the effective date of coverage in relation to trip cancellations, and how does this affect claims made under Sections 19, 22, or 29 for the same event?
How does the policy handle the termination of coverage upon cancellation of a trip, and what are the specific conditions under which claims can be filed for Sections 19, 22, or 29?
In what scenarios would a claim be eligible under Sections 19, 22, or 29, and how does the policy ensure that only one section can be claimed for a single event?
What are the timeframes for coverage commencement relative to trip scheduling, and how does this influence the filing of claims for cancellations or disruptions?
How does the policy define the process for making a claim under Section 19 after a trip cancellation, and what are the consequences for the policyholder in terms of coverage termination?
What are the specific benefits and limitations associated with claims made under Sections 19, 22, or 29, and how do these sections interact with the overall policy coverage?
How does the policy ensure that claims for the same event are not duplicated across Sections 19, 22, or 29, and what documentation is required to support a claim?
What are the conditions under which the policy will commence coverage, and how do these conditions affect the ability to claim for cancellations or other covered events?
How does the policy address the situation where a trip is canceled shortly after purchase, and what are the implications for claims under the specified sections?
What are the overall benefits provided by the policy in relation to trip cancellations, and how do the different sections (19, 22, and 29) delineate the types of coverage available?
